text: William Hawley was an English footballer who played as a right-back for Huddersfield Town, Blackpool, Halifax Town, and Rotherham Town. ==Playing career== Hawley played one game for Port Vale as a guest during World War I, playing at left-half in a 2–0 defeat to rivals Stoke on 29 March 1918.
